content.text:
Find the Fourier series for the sawtooth waveform shown in <image 1>.

A. -2[sin t + (1 / 2) sin 25 + (1 / 4) sin 3t + ...]
B. -2[sin t + (1 / 2) sin 30 + (1 / 3) sin 3t + ...]
C. -2[sin t + (1 / 2) sin 25 + (1 / 3) sin 3t + ...]
D. -2[sin t + (1 / 3) sin 25 + (1 / 3) sin 3t + ...]

To find the Fourier series for the given sawtooth waveform, we need to determine the coefficients of the sine and cosine terms in the series. The general form of the Fourier series for a periodic function \( f(t) \) with period \( 2\pi \) is:

\[ f(t) = a_0 + \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \left[ a_n \cos(nt) + b_n \sin(nt) \right] \]

where
\[ a_0 = \frac{1}{\pi} \int_{-\pi}^{\pi} f(t) dt \]
\[ a_n = \frac{1}{\pi} \int_{-\pi}^{\pi} f(t) \cos(nt) dt \]
\[ b_n = \frac{1}{\pi} \int_{-\pi}^{\pi} f(t) \sin(nt) dt \]

For the sawtooth waveform shown in the figure, the function \( f(t) \) is odd, which means all the cosine coefficients \( a_n \) will be zero. We only need to calculate the sine coefficients \( b_n \).

The function \( f(t) \) can be defined piecewise as:
\[ f(t) = \begin{cases} 
t & \text{for } -\pi \leq t < 0 \\
t - 2\pi & \text{for } 0 \leq t < \pi 
\end{cases} \]

We calculate \( b_n \) using the integral:
\[ b_n = \frac{1}{\pi} \int_{-\pi}^{\pi} f(t) \sin(nt) dt \]

Since \( f(t) \) is odd, we can split the integral into two parts:
\[ b_n = \frac{1}{\pi} \left( \int_{-\pi}^{0} t \sin(nt) dt + \int_{0}^{\pi} (t - 2\pi) \sin(nt) dt \right) \]

Evaluating these integrals, we get:
\[ b_n = \frac{1}{\pi} \left( \left[ -\frac{t \cos(nt)}{n} \right]_{-\pi}^{0} + \left[ \frac{t \cos(nt)}{n} \right]_{0}^{\pi} - \left[ \frac{2\pi \cos(nt)}{n} \right]_{0}^{\pi} \right) \]

Simplifying, we find:
\[ b_n = \frac{1}{\pi} \left( \frac{2\pi}{n} - \frac{2\pi}{n} \right) = \frac{2}{n} \]

Thus, the Fourier series for the sawtooth waveform is:
\[ f(t) = -2 \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n} \sin(nt) \]

Comparing this with the given options, the correct answer is:

C. -2[sin t + (1 / 2) sin 25 + (1 / 3) sin 3t + ...]
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
